title._content: Fight! Fight! Fight! Brooklyn vs. Queens vs. Bronx vs. Manhattan in Duke Riley's Those About to Die Salute You

description._content: At the Queens Museum, artist Duke Riley is using the old Wold's Fair Ice Skating Rink to build a flotilla of five full-size Egyptian- and Peruvian-style battleships. Riley is launching the project, Those About to Die We Salute You on August 13th with an actual naval battle in Flushing Meadows, including hand-to-hand combat. Those About to Die Salute You, a battle on water wielded with baguette swords and watermelon cannon balls by New York’s art dignitaries will take place on Thursday, August 13th, 2009 at 6 pm in a flooded World’s Fair-era reflecting pool in Flushing Meadows Corona Park, just outside of the Queens Museum of Art. Various types of vessels have been designed and constructed by artist provocateur Duke Riley and his collaborators: the galleons, some made of reeds harvested in the park, will be used to stage a citywide battle of the art museums in which representatives from the Queens Museum of Art, the Brooklyn Museum, Bronx Museum of the Arts, and El Museo del Barrio will battle before a toga-clad crowd of frenzied onlookers. The event is free and open to public. More info Dress code: Toga. Live music by Hell-Bent Hooker.
